title: New England Patriots sign Nick Folk after cutting Mike Nugent
text:
CLOSE Sports Pulse: Eagles avoid a three-game losing streak, while the Brown’s rookie coach looks like he may be in over his head. USA TODAY

The New England Patriots are trying another option at kicker.

The team released Mike Nugent on Tuesday and signed Nick Folk.

Folk has played 11 seasons in the NFL, most recently for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in 2017 after stints with the Dallas Cowboys and New York Jets. He also player for the Arizona Hotshots in the now-defunct Alliance of American Football.

Nugent, 37, was filling in for starter Stephen Gostkowski, who is currently on injured reserve with a left hip injury. Nugent appeared in four games with New England and converted five of eight field goals and made all but one of his 16 extra point attempts.

In the Patriots’ 27-13 victory Sunday against the Cleveland Browns, however, he missed a 34-yard field goal that hooked well left, and also had a 29-yard try blocked.

The Patriots have been active in working out kickers to try to find a reliable option for the rest of the season while Gostkowski heals. According to ESPN, Gostkowski’s injury will require surgery and will force him to miss the rest of the season.

New England plays the Baltimore Ravens on Sunday night.

description: After Mike Nugent missed one field goal Sunday and had another blocked, the New England Patriots released the veteran kicker.
